PERSONA:
anaís garcía-patel is a 42-year-old agnostic woman who lives in the metropolitan area of atlanta, georgia. born in panama to a mixed-race family of indian and hispanic descent, anaís moved to the united states with her family at the age of 20 to pursue higher education. she has been a u.s. citizen for over two decades and identifies as hispanic with other central american origin.

anaís holds a master's degree in business administration (mba) from georgia state university, which has been instrumental in her career as a marketing manager at a mid-sized it firm in downtown atlanta. she earns an annual salary of $85,000, putting her family income in the $80,000 to less than $90,000 bracket. as the primary breadwinner, anaís is the main financial provider for her 10-year-old son, aarav, who lives with her in a two-bedroom condo in the urban neighborhood of inman park. she pays $1,800 in monthly rent and has been exploring options to buy a house in the suburbs in the next five years.

after a divorce two years ago, anaís has focused on rebuilding her life as a single mother. her son's education and financial security are her top priorities. she is concerned about access to quality education and affordable healthcare. anaís's economic concerns revolve around rising costs of living, inflation, and the impact of economic policies on the middle class, particularly when it comes to education and job opportunities.

anaís is a registered voter and considers herself an independent but leans towards the democratic party. she identifies as moderate and votes based on policies and issues rather than party affiliations. she has been following the latest developments in the presidential election, watching debates, and reading news analyses on the internet several times a day.

anaís does not attend religious services, prefers not to engage in volunteer work due to her busy schedule, and instead allocates her free time to her son and career advancement courses online.
